entry.title: Re: Service Layer – Unable to Close Inventory Transfer Re...
entry.content: Hi everyone, Big thanks to the SAP Community — and especially to Prasanth — for pointing me in the right direction. Your guidance helped me resolve the persistent -1116 (Transaction notification) error when closing an Inventory Transfer Request via the Service Layer. What worked: I used the official close action: http Copy POST https://localhost:50000/b1s/v2/InventoryTransferRequests(123)/Close Content-Type: application/json {} Adding the empty JSON body {} was the key for the Service Layer to accept the POST. Additionally, I made a configuration change in our environment: I updated the b1s_sqltable.conf file to include the relevant tables used by this process — OWTQ and WTQ1. After adding these tables, the close action completed without issues. Takeaways: Don’t PATCH the status directly; use the /Close action so SAP runs its full business logic. Ensure the document is open, the API user has the required permissions, and the request hasn’t already been fully copied to an Inventory Transfer. If you rely on SQL access through the Service Layer, confirm the necessary tables (in my case, OWTQ and WTQ1) are listed in b1s_sqltable.conf. Thanks again, Prasanth, and everyone who contributes here. Your help made all the difference!

entry.title: SAP Analytics Cloud Excel AddIn - Time Out Issue
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

we’re currently using the SAC Excel Add-In and are facing the following issue:

When a planner enters data in the Excel sheet, they need to click the “Process Data” button to persist their entries. If they don’t, the Add-In automatically logs them out after a while, and any unprocessed data is lost.

We’re looking for a way to either extend the logout timer or ensure that entered data is automatically saved (as far as I know, only mass data entry is supported in the Excel Add-In). Any workaround other than using mass data entry would help solve this problem.

Has anyone encountered this issue or found a solution?

Kind regards,

Ismail

entry.title: Parallel accounting activation in future
entry.content:
Dear Cloud Public Edition experts,

I would like to ask clarification regarding the limitation and recommendation for scope item activation after Run phase (after go-live).

My customer has decided the activation of scope item 1GA (Accounting and Financial Close – Group Ledger IFRS (1GA)) during the initial set-up phase.
However, some scope items like FI-AA matter (J62 and 1GB) are not taken into account yet.
My customer is now considering the activation in future because they have no clear business requirements as of now for IFRS treatment.

In current situation, does SAP recommend them to activate J62 and 1GB during the initial set-up phase? or after go-live when they have clear business requirements on FI-AA?

Thank you for your support & Kindly Regards,
Ai Takahashi

entry.title: SAP S/4HANA and SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition 2025 FPS00: Final What's New & Product Assistance
entry.content:
With immediate effect, the documentation for SAP S/4HANA and SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition 2025 is available. You can find this documentation on the current SAP Help Portal pages of SAP S/4HANA and SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition.

To learn more about the changed and new features in SAP S/4HANA and SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition 2025, access the What’s New information by using the following links:  What's New Viewer for SAP S/4HANA or What's New Viewer for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition.

For any feedback you may have, you can use the commenting feature for What's New.  With this feature, authors can evaluate your feedback and incorporate it into the documentation, if needed. We hope that by opening this channel of communication, we can learn how to further improve our What’s New content for you. To use this feature, you need to be logged into the SAP Help Portal. The feature is only available in the English version of the documents. To learn more about how the feedback process works in SAP Help Portal, see Giving Documentation Feedback.

entry.title: Why Clients Say No to BTP – and How to Change Their Mind
entry.content:
Hey BTP Community! Do you know that feeling? You walk into a meeting with an innovative idea, and the client—just hearing "SAP BTP"—immediately rejects it. "I don't want BTP implementation!" – they exclaim, with a look of weariness in their eyes.

Too many times, innovation, instead of solving problems, becomes... a hot potato.

Sure, there are companies boasting a full migration to BTP, but the truth is, most organizations have concerns. Concerns about the new, about the cost, about too much detachment from the stable, "on-premise" world.

But today, I'll show you how to turn that "No" into "Why didn't we do this sooner?" I'm presenting a true case that proves, in certain scenarios, BTP is not just better; it's the only sensible and secure solution.

End Customers Straight into S/4HANA

Problem Analysis: When On-Premise "Knowledge and Familiarity" Becomes the Biggest Risk.

Imagine a typical scenario: A client needs a portal where their end customers (B2C/B2B) can verify the status of their service requests (or other object/s existing in the S/4HANA).

On-premise decision: We create external user accounts directly in the S/4HANA system. We define roles just like for internal users. We have advanced control and know the system inside out. Sounds good, right?

This approach, while familiar, introduces critical risks and burdens:

  1. Security Risk: This is my biggest headache. An external user, even with the most restrictive role, works on the same system as critical business processes and your internal employees. There is a risk (or its perception) that the user will gain access to data they shouldn't. This discomfort is a real threat to your company.

  2. Performance Issues: Suddenly, your customers start working on the same system as your business processes! Increased traffic, planned jobs, mass status verifications... all of this burdens S/4HANA. Planning for increased resource consumption is required.

  3. Additional Team Workload: Every request regarding access problems, passwords, or end-customer permissions lands on your Security/Basis team's desk. This burdens them, diverting them from key maintenance and development tasks.

The "SAP Plumber" Architecture: Why Are Customers Waiting in the Dark?

This scenario was further complicated by inefficient integration processes:

  1. The Customer creates a request in an old, external Legacy System (Success - 200 - Request Created in the Lagacy System).
  2. The request is saved in the Legacy Database (Status: "Staging").
  3. The Legacy System processes requests and transfers them (via API) to S/4HANA at intervals.

And here the drama begins:

  • S/4HANA REJECTS some requests for various reasons (business rules, technical errors, missing data).
  • The client receives no feedback. They just wait. And then they wait some more.
  • Finally, the request lands on the servisk desk of... System Maintenance Experts! (Our "SAP Plumber" 🔧). They painstakingly verify errors, push through messages, and waste valuable time on tasks that should be automated.

The result? Low customer satisfaction, increased pressure, and prioritization of requests that were never even processed in the first place!

 The Solution You Need: Client Portal on SAP BTP

Isolation, Visibility, Scalability – The Three True Benefits of BTP.

Client portals are an ideal, canonical use case for SAP BTP!

How does it work, technically and business-wise?

1. Isolation and Security 

  • We deploy a new Portal Application (e.g., based on SAP CAP in Node.js or Fiori/UI5) on SAP BTP.
  • End customers log in ONLY to BTP. Their accounts, users, and traffic are completely isolated from the critical S/4HANA system
  • Key logic and statuses are handled outside the ERP, in a secure BTP environment.

 

 

2. Full Request Status Visibility

  • The BTP application integrates with the Legacy system. Since SAP CAP is Node.js, we can:

    •  

      Consume existing Legacy APIs.
    • Or, if no API exists, connect directly to the Legacy Database (using the appropriate driver).
  • From the moment a request is created, the client sees its FULL and CURRENT status, directly in the BTP application.
  • (Such app is also helpfull for technical persons)
  • S/4HANA Integration: If necessary, we use secure OData APIs from S/4HANA (read-only or controlled write access) to fetch additional, approved information (e.g., invoice number, agent name). Controlled APIs are your gateway, not an open door!

3. Unleashing Data Potential

  • A bonus that is often overlooked: If we decide to use HANA DB on BTP, we automatically gain the ability to easily consume and analyze data from the Client Portal in analytical tools such as SAP DataSphere, SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC), or Business Data Cloud (BDC).

  • Creating reports, tracking progress, measuring satisfaction, and identifying bottlenecks becomes trivially simple.

Break Client Resistance. Turn "No" into "I Need This."

A client who says "No to BTP" is actually saying:

  • "I don't want additional costs."
  • "I don't want complications."
  • "I don't understand how this will help me."

My answer:
"BTP is not an end goal; BTP is a tool that eliminates critical architectural and business risks."

When integration is so strongly tied to the SAP S/4HANA ecosystem, and the requirements are data isolation and scalability —  SAP BTP is good choice.

Leave Kudos if You like it 🙂

entry.title: Creating a BP (Customer Role) and Associating a Company
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

I’m currently working on a project where I need to create a Business Partner in SAP and assign the Customer role (ZFLCU0) to it. I have the code working for these parts, but I’m struggling with the last step — associating a company to the Business Partner.

Here is the code I have so far, which is functional:

ls_central-SEARCHTERM1 = customer-name1.
ls_central-PARTNERTYPE = 'GE00'.
APPEND ls_central TO lt_central.

" Create Business Partner
CALL FUNCTION 'BAPI_BUPA_CREATE_FROM_DATA'
  EXPORTING
    partnercategory = '1'
    centraldata = ls_central
  IMPORTING
    business_partner = lv_bpartner
  TABLES
    return = lt_return.

" Assign Customer Role (ZFLCU0)
CALL FUNCTION 'BAPI_BUPA_ROLE_ADD'
  EXPORTING
    businesspartner = lv_bpartner
    businesspartnerrole = 'ZFLCU0'
  TABLES
    return = lt_return.

" Commit creation and changes
CALL FUNCTION 'BAPI_TRANSACTION_COMMIT'
  EXPORTING
    wait = abap_true.

Thanks in advance for your help!

entry.title: Early Adopter Care - Extend Latest People Profile with BTP Custom Cards
entry.content:
Extending People Profile with data that is specific to your company's employees is something that a large majority of SuccessFactors customers use already. Getting a 360 degree view of the employee data is something that is at the heart of People Profile. With MDF custom objects we have always provided such in-app extension capability in People Profile and it is used by more than 75% of customers.  Now we take this a step further and enable side-by-side extensions with BTP custom cards, which allow to display employee data from BTP extensions in Full Profile of Latest People Profile.

Including employee data available on BTP into Full Profile via BTP custom cards is available with the 2H 2025 release for early adopter care customers. Please see the schematic picture of such side-by-side extensions:

The creation of such extension is triggered from the Configure Latest People Profile page via the Extensibility Wizard, which is the new common entry point for creating extensions across SAP Business Suite. As long as your BTP extension provides an API, you will be able to access this data from a UI Integration Card, which is implemented in SAP Business Application Studio in SAP Build and is then deployed to SuccessFactors. Once deployed, it can be added to Full Profile in any category.

If you have BTP-based extensions with employee data that you would like to make available in People Profile, then you are a candidate for our Early Adopter Care program, which starts with the 2H 2025 release. There are some prerequisites to participate in the program:

  • You have a BTP Global Account on Cloud Foundry and a SAP Build license.
  • You have an extension application running in a BTP subaccount (or plan to build one). E.g., an application developed with SAP Build Apps or SAP Build Code. The application provides an API that can be called from a UI Integration Card implemented in Business Application Studio. Typically, this would be a REST or OData API.
  • You have implemented IAS in SuccessFactors.
  • Full Profile in Latest People Profile is active in your SuccessFactors instance. Full Profile is opt-out with 2H 2025.

There are a few restrictions with this capability in this very first release.

  • BTP Custom Cards only support view mode.
  • We recommend that BTP custom cards have the same height as regular cards in Full Profile. This allows for a consistent UI experience.
  •  Links in custom cards will always open a new window or tab.

If you fulfill the prerequisites and would like to try this new extension capability as an early adopter care customer, please contact @stockp via direct message here in the community or via email to peter.stock@sap.com. We can provide you additional material around this capability and carry out the qualification for this program.

Take advantage of this opportunity for your company to engage directly with SAP development and the Product Management teams. As part of this initiative, you will have the opportunity to actively participate in shaping the functionality over the next several months until it becomes generally available (GA). Registration is open now!

entry.title: 2H2025 - Introducing Public Content Links: Seamless Static Content Hosting in SuccessFactors
entry.content:
In the previous versions of SuccessFactors, administrators had to contact Technical Support to host static content publicly, which was often time-consuming and required additional support.

With the 2H2025 release, SuccessFactors has introduced a new feature that streamlines this process, allowing administrators to host static content directly from the Admin Center.

Let’s explore the new Public Content Links feature and how it can revolutionize your static content management. 💡

In the Admin Center administrators now have the capability to access a dedicated Public Content Links page.

The feature allows users to upload or replace static content, which is then hosted in a public directory accessible to anyone with the link. It will replace the cumbersome support process and will empower administrators to fulfill their tasks at any time without any process delays

What Prerequisites do you have to consider?

Before using this feature, ensure that you meet the following prerequisites:

Grant the necessary permissions

As the documents will be publicly accessible, only few dedicated administrators in a company should get access to this feature. Therefore, we introduced 2 new Role-Based Permissions (Manage Permission Roles --> Administrator Permissions --> Admin Center Permissions --> Static Content File Hosting) that need to be granted:

You can distinguish between just having the upload permission or having both the upload and replace permissions:

1. **Upload**: Permits users to upload new content and generate public links.
2. **Replace**: Permits users to replace existing content by providing its public link.

Enable Email Notifications

If a user uploads a file to be publicly hosted a public link to access this file will be generated. After the upload the link will be shown in the UI, but it will also be send to the user via an email. To receive that email, the email notifications need to be enabled for the administrator. 

This can be verified through Admin Center --> Change User Email Notification.

Additionally, users must enable email notifications in their profile settings under Settings (profile icon) --> Notifications --> Send emails to me.

                               

The Doing - How to Upload or Replace Static Content

As mentioned before, the newly introduced Public Content Links feature enables administrators to upload new content as well as replace existing existing content. 

Upload New Static Content

Uploading new content is pretty straight forward in the Public Content Links page.

The administrator can select the file that shall be uploaded, and add a description if necessary. 

Additionally, the administrators have to confirm our "terms and conditions", which are:

  • SAP offer this service for documents used in the SAP SuccessFactors context only. SAP reserves the right to delete any files it determines are used for impermissible purposes, or if the Customer's SAP SuccessFactors Cloud Service subscription is terminated. 
  • The URL we generate will provide access to the file without any additional permission check, as the documents are hosted on a publicly available directory.
  • The customer has to represent that they have all necessary rights to use and share the file.
  • It needs to be confirm that this file will not be treated as or include Confidential Information.

By accepting the terms and conditions and clicking the upload button, the document will be sent to the hosting directory. Before that happens, there'll be one final confirmation message to ensure you're absolutely sure about the upload. We get it, nobody likes too many steps 😉, but we strongly believe that uploading a file from an HR system to a public directory should be a mindful process.

After the upload the user gets a confirmation message that includes the link to access the file:

Because the link disappears when the user closes the dialog box, an email containing the link is also sent:

Replace Existing Static Content

Replacing an already hosted file with a new one is as easy as uploading a new file. There are only 2 additional pieces of information needed on the Public Content Links page:

The administrator can select the file that shall be uploaded, and add a description if necessary - both actions are the same as when uploading a new file.

The administrator now needs to enable the toggle Replace Existing File. With that a new, mandatory input field "Existing File URL" will show up on the page. The user can input the URL of the previously hosted content that he wants to replace with the new file.
Having done that, the terms and conditions need to be confirmed again.

Clicking the Upload button will show a popup to confirm the action as well as inform the user that although the file will be replaced by the new one, the existing URL will stay the same. So, if the name of the file is different to the one that shall be replaced, this will not be reflected in the URL, as you can see in the screenshot of the confirmation message below. 

When the administrator confirms by clicking the Upload button, the existing hosted file will be replaced by the newly uploaded one and a success message will be displayed. For completeness the success message as well as the confirmation email sent out to the user will include the URL again, although it hasn't changed.

What's not in (yet)? - Restrictions and Limitations

Similar to the former static content file hosting by SAP SuccessFactors Support organization, there are some limitations and restrictions you need to consider:

File Type and File Size Limitations

The Public Content Links self-service tool supports the following:

  • Videos: mp4 (up to 100 MB)
  • Images: jpg/jpeg/png (up to 1 MB)
  • Documents: pdf/doc/docx/ppt/pptx/csv/xls/xlsx (up to 10 MB)

Access Restrictions

This feature is not accessible when acting as a proxy. Only the logged-in user’s own session allows access to the Public Content Links tool.

(Current) Functional Tool Limitations

In the 2H2025 functional scope the self-service tool provides the option to upload and replace files, however it does not support deleting uploaded files. This means, if you for whatever reason have uploaded the wrong file or replaced a file with a wrong file, you cannot delete this wrongly uploaded content. As a workaround we suggest to replace the wrongly uploaded file with an (empty) dummy file and not sharing the URL.

We are planning to provide the deletion functionality in the next release 1H2026.

Also not yet available in the 2H2025 release is an overview of all publicly hosted documents of a customer. This is also planned to be included in the next release.

Migration of already hosted files, uploaded prior 2H2025

Although, the Public Content Links tool will replace the former process via support ticket, there is no migration of the already hosted files planned, that were uploaded prior 2H2025.

In case you like to replace an already hosted file, you still need to create a support ticket. 

Saying that I would assume you know all the important facts to be ready for using the new self-service tool. 

I hope this service makes the daily life of your administrators easier and increases their efficiency and happiness 😉.

You might want to check out the additional resources:

WNV: Public Links for Hosting Static Content 

Documentation: Uploading Static Content and Generating a Public Link and Replacing Existing content at a Public Link 

Stay tuned for more updates on Document Management soon! 👍

entry.title: Re: Product Master Classification
entry.content:
Dear @MR71,

Option A: Custom field on Product

            Setup:

  1. Custom Fields→ create field on Product Master as a Code List with 5 fixed values (e.g., 1–5 or A–E with labels).
  2. Enable it for UIs/Services and Publish.
  3. In Manage Product Master Data, adapt the UI to show the field.

Result:

  • On the Product screen (your added section/field).
  • Build a list/report via Custom CDS View (join Product basic data; add your custom field) and save as a tile.
  • You can also filter by the field in product and stock apps once exposed.

 

Option B: Classification with a 5-value characteristic

Setup:

  1. Manage Characteristics → create CATEGORY with 5 allowed values.
  2. Manage Classes → create MATERIAL_CLASS and assign the characteristic.
  3. Classify Products → assign the class to products and set the value in manage product master data in classification tab

Result:

  • Add to analytics with a Custom CDS View / Custom Analytical Query that reads product classifications.

Best Regards

Dawid

entry.title: Re: Creating a BP (Customer Role) and Associating a Company
entry.content:
To associate a company (i.e., assign company code data to the Business Partner), you need to create customer company code data using the appropriate BAPI. The BAPI you're currently using (BAPI_BUPA_CREATE_FROM_DATA) only creates the general Business Partner record. Assigning a company requires customer-specific data under a company code.

You should use BAPI_CUSTOMER_CREATEFROMDATA1 after assigning the customer role where

  • ls_companydata includes the company code and other financial data.
  • ls_companydatadetail includes payment terms, reconciliation account, etc.

Alternatively, if the Business Partner already exists and you just want to extend it to a company code, use BAPI_CUSTOMER_CHANGEFROMDATA1. After assigning company data, don’t forget to commit

entry.title: Re: How to handle “usernames”, “Global User IDs” and “external IDs” in your landscape?
entry.content:
Hi @1Gunnar @Colt 

I'm curently using the UUID based on the Entra Atribute as per https://help.sap.com/docs/cloud-identity/system-integration-guide/step-by-step-example-for-setting-up-global-user-id

but unfortunately this can be done only to non-employees since the employees are syched from SSFF to IAS and the UUID is autogenerated and written back to SF as part of the standard integration and this currently is not switchable.

I'm using the Subject name Identifier with the Global User ID for al applications that allow it. Even in case of Joule or taskcenter currently it's mandatory to use that way and also the UUID has to be provisioned to SU01. This requieres a change in the principal propagation and the Cloud Connector does not accept different configs, so in the end you have to use UUID for everything. In case of SAC for example, you can setup using SAML SSO using "Custom Attribute" and use the UUID as Subject name identifier that should match the custom SAML atribute defined in the SAC user.

entry.title: From Foundation to Future: Master Data Management as the Fuel for Gen AI
entry.content:
In today's fast-paced business landscape, the role of Master Data Management (MDM) has evolved significantly, transitioning from a fundamental process improvement tool to a critical enabler of advanced analytics and AI. Join us for an interactive webinar, "From Foundation to Future: Master Data Management as the Fuel for Gen AI," where we delve into the evolution of MDM and its pivotal role in empowering next-generation AI technologies.

What to Expect

Introduction to The Hackett Group and Their Latest MDM Study

Kickstarting our session, we will introduce The Hackett Group and share insights from their latest 2025 MDM study. This will set the tone for our detailed discussion on the evolution and impact of Master Data Management.

Traditional Applications of MDM

We will then explore the traditional applications of MDM, highlighting its role in business process improvement. Through line-of-business-specific examples, you'll gain a clear understanding of how MDM has been utilized to streamline operations and enhance efficiency.

Contemporary MDM Use Cases

Diving deeper, we will examine more contemporary MDM use cases to illustrate how clean master data drives effective analytics, AI, and ultimately, improved decision-making. These examples will underscore the transformative potential of MDM in today's data-driven world.

SAP Master Data Governance

We will weave in throughout the capabilities of SAP Master Data Governance, demonstrating its role in achieving operational excellence and accurate analytics. Moreover, we will discuss how AI within MDM is driving new value and accelerating business process excellence.

Meet Our Speakers

Bryan DeGraw, Market Intelligence Analyst

Bryan DeGraw, Market Intelligence Analyst at The Hackett Group, is the author of their MDM Matrix Study. His insights and expertise in MDM will provide a comprehensive understanding of its past, present, and future.

Andreas Seifried, SAP MDM Product Management

Andreas Seifried, from SAP MDM Product Management, will share his knowledge on how SAP Master Data Governance can fuel enable businesses to stay ahead in the competitive marketplace.

Why Attend?

1. Insightful Perspectives: Gain valuable insights from industry experts on the evolution of MDM.
2. Practical Examples: Learn from real-world examples that demonstrate the impact of MDM on business processes and decision-making.
3. Future Trends: Understand how MDM is shaping the future of AI and how you can leverage it for your organization.
4. Interactive Session: Engage with our speakers through Q&A sessions and interactive discussions.

Register Now!

Don't miss out on this opportunity to explore how Master Data Management is impacting the business landscape. Register now to stay ahead of the curve and discover how MDM can be the fuel your organization needs to harness the power of Gen AI and secure operational excellence.

We look forward to seeing you at the webinar!

entry.title: Re: Automatic PO with Goods Receipt
entry.content: To get details about (and options for) submitting your questions to SAP Community, please see the Asking and Answering Questions in the Community Af... - SAP Community. You may also want to watch How do I ask a question from a category page? as this how-to video illustrates one approach for posting a question to SAP Community. Before you ask a question, please browse the community in case this question has been answered already. If you need to create a new question, start with a descriptive title that briefly outlines what your question is about. A clear question title will help community members gain a quick initial understanding of your question. It will also help community members find your question (and its answers) when they are searching for solutions to similar problems. When writing your question, please share what steps you took that led you to your question. If you don't, community members might tell you to take actions you've already tried yourself. Make sure that your question is very specific. Provide as many details as you can -- such as which product version you are using and what error message you're receiving. Include screenshots if possible.

entry.title: Re: How to handle “usernames”, “Global User IDs” and “external IDs” in your landscape?
entry.content:
Hello,

the Cloud Connector allows rules to create the string in the username-certificate. The default is something like "CN={name}" and often contains the email. To not break BTP integrations with older features or stacks I would now add a condition like "IF userUuid is present in the token" create a different string like "CN={name}, OU={userUuid}".

With this approach the S/4HANA in scope for newer integrations like SAP Task Center or SAP Joule could be configured in the CERTRULE to look for the "OU={userUuid}" in the certificate and identify the user with Global User ID.

The other stacks e.g. older versions using the same Cloud Connector could still consume the CN from the certificates.

For very new S/4HANA stacks even an OIDC integration with Cloud Identity is now possible, but it depends on the requirements if this a feasible architecture for your landscape. 

In general, please use the Cloud Identity Services in front of your SAP landscape. New features rely on this and even activities outside of SAP could break alternative integration flows e.g. iFrames.

BR
Gunnar

entry.content:
Hi @1Gunnar 

I thought of such rule but the problem is that "user_uuid" is as per default included in the attributes when configuring a new subaccount. So all the subaccounts are currently having user_uuid  in IAS app and passing it to BTP. Techincally I'm not using it for all global accounts except for the Joule/TaskCenter ones where the UUID is also the SNI. For the rest of the subaccounts we're currently using Login Name to match SU01 user ID and we'd like to keep it that way for now until we can do a full switch to UUID for everithing.

Disabling the user_uuid attribute in IAS for the Subaccounts not using Global user ID should not technically cause any problem then?

entry.title: TDS Limit in SAP Based on total invoice amount for fiscal year done.
entry.content:
Hi Team,

I got a requirment from business which is i got find to done with customization with the help of enhancement,

Purpose / Objective:

The purpose of this Business requirment implementing a TDS (Tax Deducted at Source) threshold limit configuration in SAP.
Currently, the system deducts TDS on every invoice amount without checking the cumulative transaction value for each vendor at PAN.

This leads to incorrect or non-compliant deductions.

The objective of this development is to ensure that TDS is deducted only after the total transaction value for a PAN exceeds the statutory threshold limit (₹50,00,000) within a financial year.

Business Requirement

TDS should be deducted only when the cumulative invoice/payment value for a vendor PAN in a financial year exceeds ₹50,00,000.
The system must check the total amount posted for each vendor PAN from the start of the fiscal year (April) and apply TDS only when the threshold is crossed.

 

Functional Requirements:

 

TABLE

Description

INPUT Logic.

FIELD

OUTPUT                               

LFA1

Fetch Vendor by Vendor PAN detail.

Vendor PAN

J_1IPANNO

Vendor Code of same PAN

LFBW

Pass Vendor Code and get the vendor with withholding tax type 194Q-4Q

Vendor Code which I got from LFA1(J_1IPANNO)

WITHT

Vendor Details which only have TDS type 194Q-4Q

As a Functional i have created the logic but i am confuged with from which table i can pick vendor invoice amount( which is final net amount after all kind of case which can reduce vendor invoice line item except vendor payment) I triend with BSEG, But BSEG is very big table, It will not work with BSEG. Please help me with the other solution other than BSEG, I avoid BSEG here, If only BSEG help here please give a clear logic. But provide any other solution.

entry.title: Re: Material Purchase Text Not Printed for Subcontracting...
entry.content:
In your case, why it is happening is because, Subcontracting items (category L) are treated differently in SAP Public Cloud. The system prioritizes component-level texts because the BOM explosion logic assumes that the supplier needs details about the components being sent for processing. The main material's purchase text is not automatically retrieved or printed in the PO output for these items.

You explored BAdI MMPUR_PO_STD_ITEM_TEXT, which is technically the right enhancement spot. However, in the subcontracting context, input variables are often empty or not populated early enough, making it ineffective for injecting the main material’s purchase text.

Explore the below some workaround options

If you're using SAP Forms by Adobe, consider enhancing the form logic to explicitly fetch the purchase text for the main material using the material number from the PO item. This can be done via CDS view extension and Custom logic in the form data provider class (if available in your edition)

Create a custom text field or use an unused standard text type to manually maintain the main material’s purchase text. Use output parameter determination to include this text in the PO output.

While MMPUR_PO_STD_ITEM_TEXT is limited, you might explore CDS views like I_PurchaseOrderItemText or I_MaterialText to fetch the required text. Use Custom Logic (via In-App Extensibility) to enrich the PO item data before output generation.

entry.title: Forecasting in Intercompany Stock Transfer Scenario
entry.content:
Hi All,

Issue Statement: Forecasting in Intercompany Stock Transfer Scenario

We are working with an intercompany stock transfer setup in SAP S/4HANA, where:

  • Plant A is the supplying plant under Company Code A
  • Plant B is the selling plant under Company Code B

The challenge arises in the forecasting process:

  • The sales demand originates from Plant B, making it the logical source of truth for forecasting.
  • However, consumption postings (e.g., movement types 687 and 601) are recorded against Plant A, the supplying plant.

This creates a disconnect between where the demand is generated (Plant B) and where consumption is posted (Plant A), which complicates the forecasting process. How can I get the forecast consumption ? 

 

  • How should forecasting be handled in this scenario to ensure accurate demand planning at Plant B?
  • Is there a standard SAP approach to link consumption data from Plant A back to Plant B for forecasting purposes?
  • Should we consider custom logic or reporting to reflect true demand at Plant B?

entry.title: Re: TDS Limit in SAP Based on total invoice amount for fi...
entry.content:
Here are the tables and strategies you can use to avoid BSEG while still getting accurate invoice totals:

Use Table BKPF + BSIK/BSIS (Open Items) or BSAK/BSAS (Cleared Items). BKPF for Document header table. Use it to filter by fiscal year, company code, document type, and posting date. BSIK for Vendor open items (subset of BSEG). BSAK for Vendor cleared items (subset of BSEG). These tables are much smaller and indexed for performance.

Logic is as follows:

  • Join BKPF and BSIK/BSAK using BELNR, BUKRS, and GJAHR and filter by:
  • LIFNR (Vendor Code)
  • BUDAT (Posting Date) between April 1 and March 31
  • SHKZG = 'H' (Credit entries)
  • WRBTR (Amount in document currency)

If your TDS is applied on MM invoices, this is a cleaner route: Check RBKP for MM invoice header and RSEG MM invoice line items.

Logic is as follows:

  • Filter by LIFNR, BUDAT, and fiscal year.
  • Use WRBTR from RSEG for net amount.
  • Join with RBKP to get posting date and vendor.

If you're using New GL, use table FAGLFLEXA which is a powerful alternative and filter by Filter by LIFNR / BUDAT / WRBTR / RACCT. This table is optimized for reporting and supports cumulative logic well.

Finally, if none of the above options work and BSEG is the only source then, from performance tip point of view, use index tables like BSIK, BSAK, or clustered selects with FOR ALL ENTRIES. Always filter by fiscal year, company code, and vendor. Avoid SELECT * — only pull required fields like WRBTR, BELNR, BUKRS, GJAHR, LIFNR.

So with the above, the logic summary would be

  • Get PAN → Vendor Codes using LFA1 and J_1IPANNO
  • Filter Vendors with WHT Type 194Q-4Q using LFBW
  • Fetch Invoice Amounts using:
  • Preferred: BSIK, BSAK, RBKP, RSEG, FAGLFLEXA
  • Fallback: BSEG with optimized filters
  • Aggregate by PAN and Fiscal Year
  • Apply TDS only if cumulative > ₹50,00,000

entry.title: Re: Regular Vendor: Single Material - Mutiple Purchase or...
entry.content:
The root cause of your issue is Regular Vendor assignment in SAP is material-centric, not Purchase Organization-specific. This means when you assign a regular vendor for a material, SAP updates the record globally for that material, not scoped to a specific Purchase Org. Even though Purchase Organizations 1000 and 2000 belong to different company codes, SAP still treats the regular vendor as a single field in the material master (typically in the purchasing view), not differentiated by org. The warning message “Up to now, supplier XYZ has been the regular supplier for this material” confirms that SAP is referencing a global setting.

So the recommended approach would be to use Info Records Instead of Material Master. Maintain vendor-specific info records for each Purchase Organization and material combination. In the info record, you can define the regular vendor per Purchase Org, which is more granular and avoids overwriting.

If your business process requires regular vendor assignment per Purchase Org in the material master, consider a custom enhancement. Explore user exit or BAdI (e.g., ME_PROCESS_PO_CUST) to control or validate vendor assignment. Store the regular vendor per Purchase Org in a custom Z-table and reference it during procurement processes.

entry.title: Re: Stock provided to vendor
entry.content:
Some workaround options are available to fix your issue

If the parts are physically at the vendor but GR was posted to your plant, do Transfer Posting with Movement Type 541 to transfer the stock to the subcontracting vendor. This will move the stock from your plant to the vendor’s special stock (O stock type). This ensures the stock is no longer considered available at your plant and is correctly reflected at the vendor.

If the GR was posted incorrectly and you want to correct it, reverse the GR using Movement Type 102. Then repost the GR to the correct location or vendor using the appropriate movement type (e.g., 101 to correct plant or 541 to vendor). This is the cleanest method if the error is recent and hasn't triggered downstream processes.

So with the above, the impact on MD04 would be

  • it will no longer show the stock as available at your plant.
  • MRP will recalculate based on the corrected stock situation.
  • You may need to run MD02 or MD03 to re-trigger planning for the material.

entry.title: ABAP code to wait for the end of "inbound bgRFC type Q" units
entry.content:
I have a program which runs parallel tasks in the same system via qRFC by using bgRFC. This scenario is called Inbound bgRFC type Q. Each task is called a unit. For more information about bgRFC, see here: bgRFC (Background Remote Function Call) | SAP Help Portal.

After the units are all started, I want to wait for them.

I propose a simple ABAP method which should work for most of situations.

There are really very few posts about bgRFC and the official documentation is missing information too, so I hope it can help some people. Note: I don't even know if the classes I use are supported by SAP and if it's the right way to do it, so all comments are welcome, thank you.

Here is the context how this method is used (WAIT_END_OF_QRFC_INBOUND_UNITS):

DATA(inbound_destination) = cl_bgrfc_destination_inbound=>create( 'ZZZ' ).

LOOP AT any_table INTO line.
  DATA(unit) = inbound_destination->create_qrfc_unit( ).
  unit->add_queue_name_inbound( line-queue_name ).

  CALL FUNCTION '...' 
     IN BACKGROUND UNIT unit
     EXPORTING ...

  INSERT unit INTO TABLE units.
ENDLOOP.

COMMIT WORK.

DATA(wait_results) = wait_end_of_qrfc_inbound_units(
                       i_watch_delay_seconds = '0.5'
                       i_units               = units ).

Little explanation: there's an internal table containing data which needs to be processed in parallel via a given RFC-enabled function module. The internal table assigns given queue names to each line of data in order to achieve the parallelization. For instance, one half of the table goes to the queue named Z1,  all calls in Z1 will be executed sequentially,  the other half goes to the queue named Z2, the calls in Z1 and Z2 will be executed in parallel).

COMMIT WORK creates the inbound bgRFC units in the database (function module calls and parameters) and all the queues are started by the bgRFC scheduler. You can see the units via the transaction SBGRFCMON.

Prerequisite: the inbound destination ZZZ was created via the transaction SBGRFCCONF. Nothing else needed (no prefix, no RFC destination in SM59, queue names are assigned freely by the program, etc.)

Here's the code of the method WAIT_END_OF_QRFC_INBOUND_UNITS:

CLASS zcl_bgrfc_helper DEFINITION FINAL CREATE PRIVATE.
  PUBLIC SECTION.
    TYPES ty_qrfc_inbound_units TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF REF TO if_qrfc_unit_inbound WITH EMPTY KEY.
    TYPES:
      BEGIN OF ty_bgrfc_unit_state,
        unit         TYPE REF TO if_qrfc_unit_inbound,
        "! Time at which the information was collected
        timestamp    TYPE timestampl,
        unit_success TYPE abap_bool,
        unit_error   TYPE abap_bool,
        "! In case there's a unit error
        unit_state   TYPE bgrfc_unit_state,
        queue_error  TYPE abap_bool,
        "! In case there's a queue error
        queue_state  TYPE qrfc_queue_state,
      END OF ty_bgrfc_unit_state.
    TYPES ty_bgrfc_unit_states TYPE SORTED TABLE OF ty_bgrfc_unit_state WITH UNIQUE KEY unit.

    CLASS-METHODS wait_end_of_qrfc_inbound_units
      IMPORTING i_watch_delay_seconds      TYPE numeric DEFAULT 5
                i_units                    TYPE ty_qrfc_inbound_units
      RETURNING VALUE(r_bgrfc_unit_states) TYPE ty_bgrfc_unit_states.

    CLASS-METHODS get_timestamp
      RETURNING VALUE(r_result) TYPE timestampl.
ENDCLASS.

CLASS zcl_bgrfc_helper IMPLEMENTATION.
  METHOD wait_end_of_qrfc_inbound_units.
    TYPES:
      BEGIN OF ty_queue,
        queue_name TYPE qrfc_queue_name,
        dest_name  TYPE bgrfc_dest_name_inbound,
      END OF ty_queue.
    TYPES tt_queue TYPE SORTED TABLE OF ty_queue WITH UNIQUE KEY queue_name dest_name.
    TYPES:
      BEGIN OF ty_unit_and_queue,
        unit       TYPE REF TO if_qrfc_unit_inbound,
        queue_name TYPE qrfc_queue_name,
        dest_name  TYPE bgrfc_dest_name_inbound,
      END OF ty_unit_and_queue.
    TYPES tt_unit_and_queue TYPE SORTED TABLE OF ty_unit_and_queue WITH UNIQUE KEY unit
                            WITH NON-UNIQUE SORTED KEY by_inbound_queue COMPONENTS queue_name dest_name.

    DATA ls_unit_and_queue TYPE REF TO ty_unit_and_queue.

    DATA(lt_queue) = REDUCE #(
                    INIT lt_queue_2 = VALUE tt_queue( )
                    FOR <lv_unit> IN i_units
                    FOR <lv_queue_name> IN <lv_unit>->get_queue_names_inbound( )
                    NEXT lt_queue_2 = COND #(
                         WHEN NOT line_exists( lt_queue_2[ queue_name = <lv_queue_name>
                                                           dest_name  = <lv_unit>->destination->dest_name ] )
                         THEN VALUE #( BASE lt_queue_2
                                       ( queue_name = <lv_queue_name>
                                         dest_name  = <lv_unit>->destination->dest_name )  )
                         ELSE lt_queue_2 ) ).

    DATA(lt_unit_and_queue) = VALUE tt_unit_and_queue( FOR <lv_unit> IN i_units
                                                       FOR <lv_queue_name> IN <lv_unit>->get_queue_names_inbound( )
                                                       ( unit       = <lv_unit>
                                                         queue_name = <lv_queue_name>
                                                         dest_name  = <lv_unit>->destination->dest_name ) ).
    WHILE lt_unit_and_queue IS NOT INITIAL.

      WAIT UP TO i_watch_delay_seconds SECONDS.

      LOOP AT lt_unit_and_queue REFERENCE INTO ls_unit_and_queue.
        DATA(bgrfc_unit_state) = cl_qrfc_client_inbound=>get_unit_state( ls_unit_and_queue->unit->unit_id ) ##NEEDED.
        CASE bgrfc_unit_state.
          WHEN if_bgrfc_client=>unit_state_runnable
            OR if_bgrfc_client=>unit_state_in_execution
            OR if_bgrfc_client=>unit_state_blocked ##NO_HANDLER.
          WHEN if_bgrfc_client=>unit_state_executed.
            r_bgrfc_unit_states = VALUE #( BASE r_bgrfc_unit_states
                                           ( unit         = ls_unit_and_queue->unit
                                             timestamp    = get_timestamp( )
                                             unit_state   = bgrfc_unit_state
                                             unit_success = abap_true ) ).
            DELETE lt_unit_and_queue USING KEY loop_key.
          WHEN OTHERS.
            r_bgrfc_unit_states = VALUE #( BASE r_bgrfc_unit_states
                                           ( unit       = ls_unit_and_queue->unit
                                             timestamp  = get_timestamp( )
                                             unit_state = bgrfc_unit_state
                                             unit_error = abap_true ) ).
            DELETE lt_unit_and_queue USING KEY loop_key.
        ENDCASE.
      ENDLOOP.

      LOOP AT lt_queue REFERENCE INTO DATA(queue).
        DATA(bgrfc_queue_state) = cl_qrfc_client_inbound=>get_queue_state( queue_name = queue->queue_name
                                                                           dest_name  = queue->dest_name ).
        CASE bgrfc_queue_state.
          WHEN if_bgrfc_client=>queue_state_runnable
            OR if_bgrfc_client=>queue_state_in_execution
            OR if_bgrfc_client=>queue_state_empty ##NO_HANDLER.
          WHEN OTHERS.
            LOOP AT lt_unit_and_queue REFERENCE INTO ls_unit_and_queue
                 USING KEY by_inbound_queue
                 WHERE     queue_name = queue->queue_name
                       AND dest_name  = queue->dest_name.
              r_bgrfc_unit_states = VALUE #( BASE r_bgrfc_unit_states
                                             ( unit        = ls_unit_and_queue->unit
                                               timestamp   = get_timestamp( )
                                               queue_state = bgrfc_queue_state
                                               queue_error = bgrfc_queue_state ) ).
              DELETE lt_unit_and_queue WHERE unit = ls_unit_and_queue->unit.
            ENDLOOP.
            DELETE lt_queue USING KEY loop_key.
        ENDCASE.
      ENDLOOP.
    ENDWHILE.
  ENDMETHOD.

  METHOD get_timestamp.
    GET TIME STAMP FIELD r_result.
  ENDMETHOD.
ENDCLASS.

As I said, I don't know if these classes are released by SAP:

  • cl_qrfc_client_inbound=>get_unit_state
  • cl_qrfc_client_inbound=>get_queue_state 

The method should support units which span other several inbound queues, but I didn't test it.

In my case, I could see that one unit has these states: runnable (briefly), in execution, executed. In a given queue, there's only one unit processed at a time. All the units instantiated after the one processed have the state blocked. Other states should be errors (e.g. short dump, uncaught exception, error message, etc.)

The queues have these states: empty if it doesn't contain any unit, runnable if it contains at least one unit to execute but it's not started yet, in execution when a unit is processed.

About the code, in case you want to ask: "DELETE itab USING KEY loop_key" is to delete the current line in the loop (LOOP AT itab), it corresponds to the old and less expressive syntax "DELETE itab". I used the pragma ##NO_HANDLER for CASE WHEN although it's not asked by the syntax check, the pragma is meant to be used for CATCH, when there's no code inside. 

Any way, feel free to post any comment.

Thank you for reading.

entry.title: Re: Forecasting in Intercompany Stock Transfer Scenario
entry.content:
Please understand the disconnect in your process

  • Sales demand originates at Plant B, which is responsible for customer-facing activities and should drive the forecast.
  • Consumption postings (e.g., movement types 687, 601) are recorded at Plant A, the supplying plant, due to the nature of intercompany stock transfers.
  • This leads to forecasting inaccuracies, as standard consumption-based forecasting tools in SAP S/4HANA Cloud rely on historical consumption data—available only at Plant A.

So the recommended forecasting strategy would be to consider Plant B as the Forecasting Anchor. Forecasts should be generated based on sales orders and historical demand at Plant B, not consumption at Plant A. This aligns with the business reality that Plant B drives customer demand.

Leverage Advanced Intercompany Stock Transfer (Scope Item 5HP). SAP’s advanced intercompany process includes document flow tracking and valuation in transit, which can help reconcile demand and consumption across plants2. Use the Monitor Value Chains app to trace the flow from sales order at Plant B to goods issue at Plant A.

Use forecasting tools like Predictive Material and Resource Planning (pMRP) or Demand-Driven Replenishment (DDR) with input from Plant B’s sales history. These tools allow manual overrides or external forecast inputs, which can be derived from your custom logic.

There is no standard SAP automation that links consumption at Plant A directly to demand at Plant B for forecasting. Therefore custom logic is essential to bridge this gap. Consider creating a forecast consumption proxy at Plant B using Historical intercompany STOs, Sales order quantities and Delivery schedules.
